For instance, a question that comes up in anyone‚Äôs mind when learning about an RNN is - isn‚Äôt it li Continue Reading Adding couple more to the list of links already present here‚Ä¶ CS224N: Natural Language Processing with Deep Learning | Winter 2019 - YouTube CS230: Deep Learning | Autumn 2018 - YouTube CS234 Stanford RL Winter 2019 - YouTube Convolutional Neural Networks (Course 4 of the Deep Learning Specialization) - YouTube Sequence Models - YouTube Geoffrey Hinton explains concepts in the Univ. of Toronto lectures and Andrew Ng in the Stanford lectures. Hinton explains the difference. He would also take brief diversions to explain the inspirations drawn from biological neuron and how thoughts could be encoded as vectors. His videos are short but very insightful. Andrew Ng‚Äôs lectures, perhaps has been the starting point for many of us‚Ä¶

This will compound your gains and reduce risk Invest and not speculate. A long-term, sensible, plan, is always likely to beat trying to get into short-term trends. As an expat who might relocate in the future, you need a portable solution as you move around the world - Apply now for a portable, expat-focused, investment plan! Reinvest dividends. This makes a huge difference long-term Be diversified, especially when you are older. Putting all your eggs in one basket doesn‚Äôt make sense. The key differences about living abroad are: You usually can‚Äôt get access to your home countries social security system. Back home, investing 10% of whatever you make might be enough for retirement, because you are paying into the retirement system. Many expats panic when they are older, after not putting enough aside for themselves and their family in the previous years. Tax-efficient local investment vehicles, such as ISAs in the UK, aren‚Äôt usually available for expats, so offshore investing makes more sense for most non-American expats. For American expats, most forms of offshore investing have became too difficult due to PFIC and other rules Many people are on fixed-term contracts overseas. If you are a teacher back home, you can still have a position for life, or at least it is difficult to fire you. Overseas, you are often paid more, but are on two or three year contracts working in teaching, oil & gas, intergovernmental organizations etc. This makes saving and investing even more important. Many investment providers won‚Äôt accept for certain overseas countries. Even those who do, often have restrictions if you move again. So, finding a truly portable, global and expat-friendly provider is key. So, the same fundamentals apply, but the urgency is often bigger. For Americans living overseas, the complexity is just bigger. Pained by financial indecision? Want to start investing? Reach out for assistance today! Before jumping into any video or any course, I want to tell you more about what to learn when you dive into Data Science. It is very important to understand what you need to learn. Data Science can seem overwhelming at first, and many people will tell you that you can‚Äôt be a Data Scientist without learning Calculus, Statistics, Linear Algebra, Databases, Programming, Machine Learning, Visualization, DL, NLP, ML, etc. but that‚Äôs not true. You should learn everything step-by-step. Step-1: Learn and get comfortable with Python You don‚Äôt need to only go with Python, you can also opt for R. Don‚Äôt go f Continue Reading Before jumping into any video or any course, I want to tell you more about what to learn when you dive into Data Science. It is very important to understand what you need to learn. Data Science can seem overwhelming at first, and many people will tell you that you can‚Äôt be a Data Scientist without learning Calculus, Statistics, Linear Algebra, Databases, Programming, Machine Learning, Visualization, DL, NLP, ML, etc. but that‚Äôs not true. You should learn everything step-by-step. Step-1: Learn and get comfortable with Python You don‚Äôt need to only go with Python, you can also opt for R. Don‚Äôt go for both, once you get comfortable with one the other comes in handy. Concentrate on learning the ecosystems, packages of Data Science. Step-2: Learn Data Visualization, Data Manipulation, & Data Analysis with Pandas After working and getting comfortable with Python, you might be knowing about the Pandas package. It is a high-performance Data Frame suitable for every tabular data. Step-3: Learn ML with Scikit-Learn Scikit-learn helps to predict the future and automatically finds insights from the data. It provides a perfect interface to work with. It also tunes parameters for the models. Its way of documenting is exceptional. Step-4: Take ML more into depth Understand what works best with which dataset. Learn how to interpret results & how to select which feature should say in the result. Step-5: Practice For practicing you will have many online sites where you can take part in the competitions, find some open source projects, etc. Kaggle for competitions Github for open-source projects Python communities- PyCon US, SciPy, PyData , etc. Finding some good youtube channels- Edureka Joma Tech Simplilearn StatQuest with Josh Starmer Data School 365 Data Science Krish Naik But remember before opting for any youtube channel, you should have some knowledge about DS. these channels are very good for keeping tabs and being up to date. But to learn, you need to have proper guidance and practice. For that, I would like to suggest the courses offered by Tutort Academy that are specially crafted for working professionals . Course Duration - You will learn all the relevant modules in 3-8 months Real-Time Projects - Projects are relevant to the industry and give 15+ real-time and 3+ capstone experience. These projects are taken from top MNCs and Startups. Live classes - It gets very difficult to understand and clear doubts from the recorded videos. So, they provide live classes as well as personalized doubt clearing sessions Fees - There are many courses, the fees start from Rs. 44,999/- Coding Classes - special classes for those who want to learn to code first Guarantee - they provide a 100% money-back guarantee if left unsatisfied Good Luck!

You can find a ton of tutorials on YouTube that cover everything from fundamental ideas to complex issues! Here are some recommended channels to get you started: Sentdex On YouTube, Sentdex is a channel dedicated to data science and machine learning. It is one of the greatest channels for learning ML and DS because it has produced a lot of videos on the topics. You can find whatever it is that most interests you on the channel because it divides its content into numerous categories including Machine Lear Continue Reading One of the most effective ways to learn machine learning and data science is through YouTube. You can find a ton of tutorials on YouTube that cover everything from fundamental ideas to complex issues! Here are some recommended channels to get you started: Sentdex On YouTube, Sentdex is a channel dedicated to data science and machine learning. It is one of the greatest channels for learning ML and DS because it has produced a lot of videos on the topics. You can find whatever it is that most interests you on the channel because it divides its content into numerous categories including Machine Learning Theory and Methods, Deep Learning, NLP, etc. The MIT professor who founded this channel also held a part-time teaching position at Stanford University at the time! He conducts classes both in person and via video conferencing services like Zoom or WebEx (which allows students from around the world attend classes). 2. Machine Learning with Phil Phil is the ideal channel for you if machine learning is something you're interested in. On YouTube, he has more than 60,000 subscribers, and his videos have received over 2 million views. Phil has a PhD in applied mathematics from the University of Edinburgh and is a data scientist, machine learning specialist, and entrepreneur. He worked as an engineer at Microsoft Research Cambridge before joining Google as a full-time researcher, where he created the algorithms that support the speech recognition systems used by Skype and Microsoft Word (Word 2007). In addition to providing clear, engaging, and educational video lessons that cover a variety of topics in the field of data science and machine learning, Phil also conducts live seminars on subjects like deep neural networks or reinforcement learning using Python code examples. 3. Kaggle You may explore the Kaggle community, study, and work on data science projects on the Kaggle channel on YouTube. The channel provides lectures, intelligent advice, and conversations with data scientists in its videos. No matter what industry you work in, this is one of the greatest machine learning YouTube channels for anyone who wants to experiment, learn new things, and apply those things to their own work. 4. Jeremy Howard Jeremy Howard is a data scientist with a background in philosophy. However, out of curiosity, he later used his skills in programming and statistics to create the most useful and user-friendly deep learning toolkit. His book Deep Learning for Computer Vision is an excellent resource for learning about deep learning and machine learning concepts such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) or recurrent neural networks (RNNs). The channel provides all the insights related to data science and machine learning. It is one of the best places to start your learning. Is learning from Youtube best ? YouTube has made learning simple and enjoyable. It can be helpful to learn the fundamentals of machine learning through YouTube, but there are a few things to consider before you begin your YouTube quest. Many YouTube channels offer free beginner-friendly information, however many videos are of poor quality and relevance to those just starting out with their first projects or who want to learn more about particular subjects like machine learning, data science, etc.. When it comes to learning something new, most people who use YouTube for learning struggle because they lack access to the most recent updates. As a result, they waste a lot of time experimenting with different approaches before settling on one that suits them well enough to move on to the next topic in those same classes. Watching Youtube videos for ML and DS is a good option but not the best one. If you want to start learning about machine learning and data science, these channels will help you do that. All of them are really good in what they do but some are better than others. I would recommend watching any of them as long as they have a high number of subscribers and Likes on their videos. Instead of watching Youtube videos, I suggest that you learn Machine Learning or Data Science from a reputable training institute. There are plenty of training institutes that offer high-quality ML and data science courses. Some of them are: Scaler Academy Tutort Academy upGrad Simplilearn Coursera When choosing a data science course, take into account the following variables to evaluate which institute is best for you. These various considerations include the following: Live Classes: During a live class, one can have 1:1 interaction with the teacher, clear your doubts, and understand the topic far better than in recorded videos. Mentors and instructors with experience who are knowledgeable about the subject matter and who can help you with both theory and practical issues. Real-time projects that will allow you to have better practical knowledge of these concepts. Placement support is the most vital one to look for. With better placement support, one can easily land their dream job. A professional-level course rather than a degree-type course. Small Batch Size to increase interaction between students and mentors. Interview Preparation guidance to help students crack their dream job. Profile Optimization facility to make their profile ideally fit for the job. Affordable course fees After reviewing the above criteria, I found Tutort Academy to be the only institute offering all of these features for learners in addition to other exciting learner-friendly features. While other institutes such as Scaler Academy, upGrad, Simplilearn and Coursera offer similarly good services but lack one or the other aspects listed above. Concluding my part, if I were asked to enroll in any of the institutes then, I will pick Tutort Academy as a working professional as it will be far easy for me to learn even if I have technical skills or not. Hope I could help you.

Khan Academy statistics Youtube channel The Khan Academy is a non-profit educational organization created in 2006 by Salman Khan with a mission of providing free world-class education for anyone anywhere. The Khan academy statistical Youtube channel covers nine playlist s which include video series like "Introduction to proba Continue Reading Khan Academy statistics Youtube channel The Khan Academy is a non-profit educational organization created in 2006 by Salman Khan with a mission of providing free world-class education for anyone anywhere. Their main website covers mathematics , science, computer programming, business and many other curricula using more than 4000 lecture videos . The YouTube channel has published many statistic lectures on data manipulation , creating R charts visualizing datasets and so on. The Khan academy statistical Youtube channel covers nine playlist s which include video series like "Introduction to probability concepts" Including videos like: conditional probability, Bayes theorem , hypothesis testing etc. So if you want to start learning statistics through Youtube channels, this Khan Academy Youtube channel will be helpful for learners who want to learn how to analyze data using R language. DataCamp statistical Youtube channel The DataCamp stats Youtube channel covers content about statistics and data science. The aim of this youtube channel is to help people learn how to analyze dataset, extract information from data using machine learning algorithms , perform regression analysis and use postgreSQL database. The instructor who teaches these tutorials uses a text editor while he creates R code programmatically on the screen during his videos. This youtube channels offers more than 500 video s on different topics which cover some basic statistical concepts such as: probability distributions, descriptive statistics , visualization of qualitative and quantitative variables , ANOVA techniques etc. So if you want to start looking at some basic statistical concepts, watch Data stat Youtube channel videos. The Learn statistics Youtube channels cover videos showing statistical topics such as: creating probability density function, applying and using R language to create data plots, analyzing data using ANOVA , performing hypothesis tests etc. The content of those stats Youtube channel s is exactly the same with Khan Academy tutorials in terms of storytelling and learning styles: you can see how the instructor creates programs on his computer screen while he explains what he does step by step. If you want to learn how to analyze dataset, extract information from data sources using machine learning algorithms (R language), perform regression analysis and use postgreSQL database; these tutorial YouTube channels will be helpful for your needs . There are a lot of visualization techniques applied to describe quantitative variables are covered by watching this channel. You can gain more than 380 lectures on their stats Youtube channel . if you want to learn how to deal with statistical concepts, then the "Learn statistics" youtube channel will be very helpful for your learning needs. The DataScience Stats YouTube channel cover many topics starting from probability distributions through ANOVA techniques , data manipulation in R language and performing regression analysis up to some advanced machine learning algorithms like neural networks or deep learning . The instructor shows that programs are made while he explains what he is doing step by step. This tutorial Youtube channels offers many courses that include statistical content such as: Data science fundamentals, Explain data science process , linear regression modeling etc., so if you want to start learning about the data science process, visualizing data using R language and performing statistical tests; this YouTube channels will be helpful for your learning needs.

Hello Everyone!! It is good to see you people are enthusiastic to learn about the most demanding courses in recent times. Data science and Machine Learning are the most demanding courses in this data-driven world. Every sector demands skilled data scientists and machine learning engineers to manage the data and uncover important insights from vast amounts of information. If you want to learn these courses there are many free resources like YouTube you can try your hands on. YouTube is an incredible platform packed with channels that can guide you through the complexities of these fields. Whether Continue Reading Hello Everyone!! It is good to see you people are enthusiastic to learn about the most demanding courses in recent times. Data science and Machine Learning are the most demanding courses in this data-driven world. Every sector demands skilled data scientists and machine learning engineers to manage the data and uncover important insights from vast amounts of information. If you want to learn these courses there are many free resources like YouTube you can try your hands on. YouTube is an incredible platform packed with channels that can guide you through the complexities of these fields. Whether you're a beginner or an expert, there's something for everyone. So, let's explore some amazing YouTube channels that will help you sharpen your skills and stay up to date with the latest trends. Let‚Äôs Start!! StatQuest with Josh Starmer StatQuest provides easy-to-understand tutorials on various statistical concepts and machine learning algorithms. The videos use visualizations and clear explanations to make complex topics accessible. Krish Naik Krish Naik's channel covers a wide range of topics related to data science and machine learning. It offers tutorials on various algorithms, projects, and practical tips for data analysis and model building. 3Blue1Brown Although not exclusively focused on data science and machine learning, 3Blue1Brown provides visually engaging videos that explain mathematical concepts behind various algorithms and techniques. The channel's videos can help develop a deeper understanding of the underlying principles. Siraj Raval Siraj Raval's channel covers a wide range of topics in artificial intelligence, including machine learning and data science. It offers tutorials, project demonstrations, and discussions on cutting-edge AI technologies. Google Developers Google Developers provides content related to various technologies, including machine learning and data science. The channel offers tutorials, conference talks, and discussions on Google's machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow. Drawbacks of learning from YouTube channels: YouTube videos are often standalone tutorials or demonstrations, which may lack a cohesive and structured learning path. This can make it challenging to progress systematically and build a comprehensive understanding of the subject. YouTube videos typically have time constraints, which may limit the depth and breadth of topics covered. Complex concepts or advanced techniques may not be adequately explained, leaving gaps in understanding for learners seeking more in-depth knowledge. YouTube videos have limited opportunities for hands-on exercises, practice problems, or direct engagement with instructors or peers. YouTube channels generally do not provide personalized support or guidance. If you have questions or need clarification, it may be challenging to obtain immediate assistance or engage in discussions with experts or fellow learners. Data science and machine learning are dynamic fields with continuous advancements. YouTube videos may not always reflect the latest trends, techniques, or tools, as they can become outdated relatively quickly. Hence, in addition to the discussed channels, there are also many great online courses available that can teach you the skills you need to become a data scientist and machine learning engineer. Some of the most popular online courses include: Tutort Academy It is a leading online platform specially crafted for professionals. I recommend them as an excellent option for your educational needs. They offer budget-friendly courses in collaboration with Microsoft that are well-structured and cater to the requirements of working professionals. Out of many, one of their unique features is their ability to provide personalised mentorship in different regions. These mentors help the learners to cope with the courses, resolve doubts, help in resume-making and much more. The courses are delivered through live and interactive sessions by experienced data scientists. The small batch sizes allow proper interaction with mentors, making the lectures attentive and informative. Additionally, their curriculum is regularly updated to align with industry standards. They provide real-time, domain-specific industrial-relevant projects in healthcare, finance, e-commerce, automotive, and more sectors to enhance your practical skills. By working on these projects, you gain hands-on experience. They provide 12+ domain-specialised projects that enhance your practical skills. They provide 2-step counselling where your profile gets checked by data scientists regarding its eligibility for a particular course. This helps to save time and select a course carefully that aligns with your career goal. Enrolling in a course gives you a membership valid for two years. This membership allows you the flexibility to complete the course by attending different batches and with other mentors as per your schedule. This feature ensures you can manage your time effectively while pursuing your educational goals. As they have tie-up with 250+ companies, they have a placement record of 1000+ students in top companies like Google, Microsoft, Walmart and many more. Their courses are affiliated with Microsoft, which makes a person Microsoft-Certified. Another platform is Scaler. It is an online learning platform that provides courses on subjects like data structures and algorithms, data science and ML, etc. It provides a rigorous, industry-approved Data Science and Machine Learning Program. Its other features are: They have a blended learning mode which includes limited live class sessions and rest with the recorded sessions of the experts. The software courses are well-developed and the subjects like data science, ML, and AI contain theoretical concepts and practical projects. Learn in-demand skills like Statistical Analysis, Python, Spark, Hadoop, Machine Learning, Seaborn, Matplotlib, Airflow and more. Build your portfolio by working on real-life business cases which enhance your practical skills. Personal placement mentorship + Ongoing guidance after course completion + Opportunity to interact with experts. In conclusion YouTube is a great resource where one can learn and develop an idea about data science and machine learning. Mix and match different channels to find the perfect blend that suits your learning style. But as nothing comes for free, it has many limitations as mentioned above. So to gain excellence, you can try the online platforms that can help you to complete the courses successfully. I recommend Tutort Academy for its real-time projects, personalised mentorship, Microsoft-affiliated courses and of course its placement stats. It is an all-in-one platform which helps in every way to make a learner grab the best job. However, you can also check out the courses of Scaler. Remember to explore beyond these recommendations and embrace the diverse knowledge available on YouTube. With dedication, curiosity, and the power of online communities, you'll unlock endless possibilities and conquer the captivating world of Machine Learning and Data Science!!!
